commit_message:
Update SAIO setup for Ubuntu 14.04

Latest version of SAIO setup from source is failing on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS
machines. This patch adds the steps to address those.

Change-Id: Id41fbd49f5c34071bb5ce02c0ace3034c4ea63dd
Signed-off-by: Ganesh Maharaj Mahalingam <ganesh.mahalingam@intel.com>

subject: Increasing max AIO kernel limit
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-12-14 15:49:34.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Increasing max AIO kernel limit

When using multipath, the stock AIO limit per process is
to low and needs to be increased to at least 128k
This fix will increase the fs.aio-max-nr to 128k

Change-Id: Id6d8d2cb103483f75ba7b9c7b1022ebca4f143ea
Related-Bug: #1524957
'}]
commit_message:
Increasing max AIO kernel limit

When using multipath, the stock AIO limit per process is
to low and needs to be increased to at least 128k
This fix will increase the fs.aio-max-nr to 128k

Change-Id: Id6d8d2cb103483f75ba7b9c7b1022ebca4f143ea
Related-Bug: #1524957

subject: Merge bashate/pep8 lint jobs in common job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 09:54:39.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Merge bashate/pep8 lint jobs in common job

Instead of launching two separate build jobs in our CI infrastructure,
one for bashate and one for pep8, launch a single one. While the jobs
are short, the setup of the images takes a long time, so this is
friendlier to our CI infrastructure.

Use the pep8 environment as common lint target and merge the bashate job
into it.

This patch also renamed dev-requirements to test-requirements to bring it
into line with all other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: I1bf8c9b604d753237c0c007b5bc81586b4437283
'}]
commit_message:
Merge bashate/pep8 lint jobs in common job

Instead of launching two separate build jobs in our CI infrastructure,
one for bashate and one for pep8, launch a single one. While the jobs
are short, the setup of the images takes a long time, so this is
friendlier to our CI infrastructure.

Use the pep8 environment as common lint target and merge the bashate job
into it.

This patch also renamed dev-requirements to test-requirements to bring it
into line with all other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: I1bf8c9b604d753237c0c007b5bc81586b4437283

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 10:17:54.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-docs/quickstart-aio.rst', 'doc/source/developer-docs/extending.rst'], 'message': 'Updating AIO docs for Ansible playbook

soon to provide additional explanation for the bootstrap options within

Implements: blueprint convert-aio-bootstrap-to-ansible

Change-Id: I730c838a67ca03413fbdfa43ef7606d8cf2f9cd0
(cherry picked from commit 3ebad4d2c355d346018fa0af988dca5ccc540607)
'}]
commit_message:
Updating AIO docs for Ansible playbook

This documentation update ensures that deployers can still perform an AIO
playbook with the new Ansible-based AIO playbook. More docs will come
soon to provide additional explanation for the bootstrap options within
the playbook.

Implements: blueprint convert-aio-bootstrap-to-ansible

Change-Id: I730c838a67ca03413fbdfa43ef7606d8cf2f9cd0
(cherry picked from commit 3ebad4d2c355d346018fa0af988dca5ccc540607)

commit_message:
Keystone slaveification

Starting from Juno we've got an slave_connection to MySQL. In order to
increase API performance various operations can be send to slave.

Change-Id: If84045edccf16a81f37e8ec81400748a14dcbb52
Implements: blueprint keystone-slaveification
Depends-On: I80ba9d62f669e56e3d188fbc59ac1f8be716406c
Signed-off-by: Vladimir Eremin <yottatsa@yandex-team.ru>

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-12-08 21:51:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/utils.py'], 'message': "Cleanup lock files for volume/snap after deletion

Currently, the lock files for volumes/snapshot will never get cleaned
up leaving many stray lock files The problem can't easily be solved
in the locking library because it's not trivial to tell when no
processes are waiting for a lock. Instead, this change
periodically checks which volumes and snapshots have been deleted
and removes any locks for that belonged to the resource.

Change-Id: I53ca7962f051aa5154cd32e45a5f3b187eb7dbb2
Closes-Bug: #1432387
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup lock files for volume/snap after deletion

Currently, the lock files for volumes/snapshot will never get cleaned
up leaving many stray lock files The problem can't easily be solved
in the locking library because it's not trivial to tell when no
processes are waiting for a lock. Instead, this change
periodically checks which volumes and snapshots have been deleted
and removes any locks for that belonged to the resource.

Change-Id: I53ca7962f051aa5154cd32e45a5f3b187eb7dbb2
Closes-Bug: #1432387

commit_message:
Setup for translation

To start translation, we need to initially import the translation
file - and place it at the proper place so that the usual CI
scripts can handle it. The proper place is for all python
projects $PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot - see setup.cfg.

Further imports will be done by the OpenStack Proposal bot.

Change-Id: Ic405c8a808ee4eae0393e6f08da8f1569b326a59

commit_message:
Setup for translation

To start translation, we need to initially import the translation
file - and place it at the proper place so that the usual CI
scripts can handle it. The proper place is for all python
projects $PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot - see setup.cfg.

Further imports will be done by the OpenStack Proposal bot.

Change-Id: Ica2b1f8adc611af5cfa2cef715526d2764c62427

commit_message:
Fix incorrect metadata_dir for murano::dashboard

According to murano-dashboard package murano::dashboard points
to incorrect metadata_dir by default.

Downstream fix is merged, so we need to update tag for puppet-murano.
Downstream Fix: https://review.fuel-infra.org/#/c/14670/

Change-Id: Ibd083bdfabff60f7a6fe4eac42056794b8dc237f
Closes-Bug: #1518981

commit_message:
Do not create duplicate dnsmasq_dhcp_ranges

After implementing the possibility to share L2/L3 parameters
between networks it became possible to have duplicate DHCP ranges.
So we need to check for already created resources in
create_dnsmasq_dhcp_ranges function to not create duplicates.

Change-Id: I5a48a8130bb63a77551ef06cb3bdf67c1bf203aa
Closes-bug: #1526360

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-14 10:43:12.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/Puppetfile'], 'message': 'Bump Glance ref on a new tag

Update Glance ref on a new tag, because was merged upstream change [1],
which closes bug (#1499754).

Currently during deployment Glance (with Swift as backend) we have
reference to every glance image in database with credentials, like:
swift+http://services%glance:EF3tluYM@192.168.0.2:5000/v2.0/glance/049cd701

This is not correct, because if someone will change glance credentials in conf
file, this reference will be invalid.

[1] Iaf0c1c6f2188c84267e41d2d4f9bda0dbf3dccad

Closes-bug: #1499754

Change-Id: I7e80f43a8e7664eeb469a7627022c37498be712c
'}]
commit_message:
Bump Glance ref on a new tag

Update Glance ref on a new tag, because was merged upstream change [1],
which closes bug (#1499754).

Currently during deployment Glance (with Swift as backend) we have
reference to every glance image in database with credentials, like:
swift+http://services%glance:EF3tluYM@192.168.0.2:5000/v2.0/glance/049cd701

This is not correct, because if someone will change glance credentials in conf
file, this reference will be invalid.

[1] Iaf0c1c6f2188c84267e41d2d4f9bda0dbf3dccad

Closes-bug: #1499754

Change-Id: I7e80f43a8e7664eeb469a7627022c37498be712c

commit_message:
Object: Add filters to contianer list

This patch addes filters when doing container.list().
One example is when list containter, we might want only list some specify
contianers with given bay_uuid:
objects.Container.list(context, filters={'bay_uuid': 'uuid'})

Partially implements: blueprint add-bay-column-to-container
Change-Id: Ia2f7e6664b8dce77c61bdf18c1ffecd28c8c49b8

commit_message:
Update telemetry API v2 to make these changes

- Spell-check and remove passive voice
- Renamed code samples using this naming convention:
  <resource>-<action>-request.json or <resource>-<action>-response.json.
  For example, volume-create-request.json and volume-create-response.json.
- Removed unused code samples
- Made method names consistent throughout - use list<resource> for list
  operations, show<resource> for show operations, and so on.

Change-Id: I1fa3f4c2170f6472ea54575d16b62187b0ac0bb3
Partial-Bug: #1521244

commit_message:
Remove clients from default PROJECTS list

Devstack by default installs client libs from pypi and not from source
so we don't need to set them all up by default here. Also due to
implementation details of how the ironic jobs work we remove ironic as
well. The cross project dep ensures the jobs are all explicitly setting
this up as necessary before removing it from d-g.

Change-Id: Iabf4c0c22413b0d238f3b40822fb7c2ed84c2e0e

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-15 06:50:11.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/identity/admin/v3/test_users.py', 'tempest/services/identity/v3/json/identity_client.py', 'tempest/api/identity/v3/test_users.py'], 'message': 'Make v3 update_user_password use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes update_user_password of v3 identity_client use **kwargs.
Also update doc string for the same.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I6507e87a02f94191f5bfd6c9c1c1b18a88f4c532
'}]
commit_message:
Make v3 update_user_password use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes update_user_password of v3 identity_client use **kwargs.
Also update doc string for the same.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I6507e87a02f94191f5bfd6c9c1c1b18a88f4c532

commit_message:
Provide option to only validate template

The heat-translator users may only want to validate template without an actual
translation. Create a new optional arg that will only validate template
without running translation.

Change-Id: Ibd17042b365c4c24940e693b87f908a38c681391
Partially Implements: blueprint template-validation-only

commit_message:
Fix router debug command

After the changes for drivers in Liberty, the astara-debug-router script
was broken.  This script helps to debug how a worker processes a single
message and enables PDB usage.

This is a modified backport since the files were moved in the master branch.

Change-Id: I69f04ff6f04a58d45737dca770f585f468e3ad58
Closes-Bug: 1524979

commit_message:
Merge bashate/pep8 lint jobs in common job

Instead of launching two separate build jobs in our CI infrastructure,
one for bashate and one for pep8, launch a single one. While the jobs
are short, the setup of the images takes a long time, so this is
friendlier to our CI infrastructure.

Use the pep8 environment as common lint target and merge the bashate job
into it.

This patch also renamed dev-requirements to test-requirements to bring it
into line with all other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Ieeffb7719b88213aaafa02073f931c491d3deee3

commit_message:
Rename key_management to key_manager

Some time ago, the Key Management service was renamed to Key Manager
service in the governance repo. We originally stuck to naming it Key
Management *because* it was named as such in the projects.yaml file, and
because it has changed, we should follow how it's named there.

Change-Id: Id5c1bd617a02e21e91f01ec095f817222c535138

commit_message:
Add neutron/plugin/common/constants.py module to neutron-lib

This patch proposes the addition of plugin constants module to
neutron-lib. Instead of creating a new file plugin_constants,
this patch appends them to the existing constants module
within neutron-lib.

Change-Id: Id1cb3b36a0409660ff585ef098f5315ccd37af9f
Implements: blueprint neutron-lib

subject: Fixed k8s redis example in quickstart guide
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-05 04:36:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/dev-quickstart.rst'], 'message': "Fixed k8s redis example in quickstart guide

The demo of redis replication controller didn't work for a while.
The reason is that the redis-sentinel failed right after it starts.
That is because the docker image is incorrectly built.

As part of the fix, a fixed redis image was built and uploaded to
docker hub. We temporarily switch to the fixed image until the
official image is fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1523040
Change-Id: I19ca2f1c6df13b9592af7434fa3a7df49dfc79b3
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed k8s redis example in quickstart guide

The demo of redis replication controller didn't work for a while.
The reason is that the redis-sentinel failed right after it starts.
That is because the docker image is incorrectly built.

As part of the fix, a fixed redis image was built and uploaded to
docker hub. We temporarily switch to the fixed image until the
official image is fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1523040
Change-Id: I19ca2f1c6df13b9592af7434fa3a7df49dfc79b3

subject: Block requests 2.9.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-15 16:40:25.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Block requests 2.9.0

The 2.9.0 release updates to urllib3 1.13 which has a regression
related to parsing IPv6 hostnames in URLs. This breaks nova and
oslo.service unit testing (at least).

This will be fixed in requests 2.10.0.

Upstream issue:

https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/760

Change-Id: Ifb080c72a16ed4b93040fb7c06bdc072b7247f6e
Related-Bug: #1526413
'}]
commit_message:
Block requests 2.9.0

The 2.9.0 release updates to urllib3 1.13 which has a regression
related to parsing IPv6 hostnames in URLs. This breaks nova and
oslo.service unit testing (at least).

This will be fixed in requests 2.10.0.

Upstream issue:

https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/760

Change-Id: Ifb080c72a16ed4b93040fb7c06bdc072b7247f6e
Related-Bug: #1526413

subject: Drop py33 support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 07:26:58.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Drop py33 support

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra
for our CI, we should drop py33 support too.

Change-Id: Ic9d4f64154a5418baa159a4efdcd9dd652d142ff
Closes-Bug: #1526170

commit_message:
Drop py33 support

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra
for our CI, we should drop py33 support too.

Change-Id: Ic9d4f64154a5418baa159a4efdcd9dd652d142ff
Closes-Bug: #1526170

subject: Make Octavia devstack pass env settings to sudo pip install
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8157, 'name': 'Bertrand LALLAU', 'email': 'bertrand.lallau@gmail.com', 'username': 'blallau'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 12403, 'name': 'Al Miller', 'email': 'al.miller@ajmiller.net', 'username': 'ajmiller'}, {'_account_id': 15226, 'name': 'Bharath M', 'email': 'bharath.stacker@gmail.com', 'username': 'bharath'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 00:34:29.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Make Octavia devstack pass env settings to sudo pip install

Current code to install diskimage-builder requirements in
devstack does not pass on enviroment settings to sudo, which can
cause the pip install to fail behind a proxy.

This happens when the user has http_proxy/https_proxy values set
but not for root.  The stack.sh runs and installs for a while,
before failing on the Octavia diskimage-builder.

Change-Id: I196aca7004ea0eed713877e54ba10dcfe1d343e7
Closes-Bug: #1526108
'}]
commit_message:
Make Octavia devstack pass env settings to sudo pip install

Current code to install diskimage-builder requirements in
devstack does not pass on enviroment settings to sudo, which can
cause the pip install to fail behind a proxy.

This happens when the user has http_proxy/https_proxy values set
but not for root.  The stack.sh runs and installs for a while,
before failing on the Octavia diskimage-builder.

Change-Id: I196aca7004ea0eed713877e54ba10dcfe1d343e7
Closes-Bug: #1526108

commit_message:
Option to supress logs for in_process test

With switch to ostestr all the server logs are being sent to stdout
which makes it completely unreadable. Adding an option to suppress
the logs.

Change-Id: I9916e06068c57973fb443e4c8ef2ed4c98c562e7
Signed-off-by: Ganesh Maharaj Mahalingam <ganesh.mahalingam@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-12-14 17:33:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py'], 'message': "DVR: handle dvr serviceable port's host change

When a VM port's host is changed we need to check if a router
should be unscheduled from old host and send corresponding
notifications.
commit d5a8074ec3c67ed68e64a96827da990f1c34e10f added such
a check when port is unbound. This patch adds similar check
in case of host change (instance live migration)

Closes-Bug: #1508869

Change-Id: I57fa8253b2c88f7b7380a79b841fc424e9e52f19
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: handle dvr serviceable port's host change

When a VM port's host is changed we need to check if a router
should be unscheduled from old host and send corresponding
notifications.
commit d5a8074ec3c67ed68e64a96827da990f1c34e10f added such
a check when port is unbound. This patch adds similar check
in case of host change (instance live migration)

Closes-Bug: #1508869

Change-Id: I57fa8253b2c88f7b7380a79b841fc424e9e52f19

commit_message:
Add Port port_security_enabled property

Explicitly parse the port_security_enabled property for a
Port object based on the property's definition in the
networking v2 API [1].

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-networking-v2.html

Change-Id: Ibd0fdd429abbea44cd56d6901f6709e8c5663f19
Closes-Bug: #1526441

commit_message:
Chronicles of a DLM

Distributed locks, the concept, the problem space, what
has been done, what could be done, what will be done,
what must be done, the journey begins now (weekdays at
7pm EST).

Updating due to summit session result, some more small
work and/or tweaks still needed.

commit_message:
Update os.path.remove as it does not exist

Os.path.remove does not exist so this removes it and replaces it with
some code that will remove the file. Functionally fulfilling the role
that os.path.remove was meant to fill.

Change-Id: I040d445007055b31561a592dd74b3e2ffaa9cd54
Closes-bug: 1507564
(cherry picked from commit 57c50ec6a6268c50a818d1883d571c618ba7a4e3)

commit_message:
remove ctype from classes

The ctype class variable in api_samples dates back to when we were
doing both xml and json api testing with them. xml is done, we can
remove all the ctype class variables as they are fully vestigial.

Change-Id: I61361d1d9d3c5b6de38b57aaef16debdba326865

Instead of having cells service started for every api samples test,
whether or not it is used, only start it on test_cells. This saves
some setup / teardown time, and makes things a bit more explicit.

It also removes the cells service from service listing for a couple of
api samples (az and hosts). That's more indicative of what people will
see in real systems as cells is still a minority and experimental
deploy option.

Change-Id: Ie6d7e8978fd2b3441a141c69d4191266d76e7327

commit_message:
Remove cells service from api samples that don't test cells

Instead of having cells service started for every api samples test,
whether or not it is used, only start it on test_cells. This saves
some setup / teardown time, and makes things a bit more explicit.

It also removes the cells service from service listing for a couple of
api samples (az and hosts). That's more indicative of what people will
see in real systems as cells is still a minority and experimental
deploy option.

Change-Id: Ie6d7e8978fd2b3441a141c69d4191266d76e7327

When running disk image builder use the build specific checkout of
system-config to install puppet and puppet modules. This allows for easy
local testing of changes to those scripts. Without it master is always
used.

Change-Id: Ifc86d77f702633d630adc1ee619f58607cb56c82
'}]
commit_message:
Install puppet using build_git system-config

When running disk image builder use the build specific checkout of
system-config to install puppet and puppet modules. This allows for easy
local testing of changes to those scripts. Without it master is always
used.

Change-Id: Ifc86d77f702633d630adc1ee619f58607cb56c82

With the spin-off of the Stable branch maintenance subteam into
its own independent team, it makes sense to revisit the mission
of the Release Management team.

The old "Release Cycle Management" team used to regroup the
Release team, the Stable branch team and the Vulnerability
Management team. Now it's only the Release team left, so we
should also rename it to the name that everyone is calling us
anyway ("Release Management").

Also update the IRC channel and the wiki landing page.

Change-Id: I71b77d350dea2d2e697e6c59792d38a0274bda28
'}]
commit_message:
Redefine Release Management team mission

With the spin-off of the Stable branch maintenance subteam into
its own independent team, it makes sense to revisit the mission
of the Release Management team.

The old "Release Cycle Management" team used to regroup the
Release team, the Stable branch team and the Vulnerability
Management team. Now it's only the Release team left, so we
should also rename it to the name that everyone is calling us
anyway ("Release Management").

Also update the IRC channel and the wiki landing page.

Change-Id: I71b77d350dea2d2e697e6c59792d38a0274bda28

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-09 09:40:24.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Spin off stable team as separate team

The Stable branch maintenance team used to be a subteam of the
Release cycle management team, much like the Vulnerability
Management team. However, its tasks were mostly handled by a
separate group, and not having its own identity and PTL arguably
prevented it from reaching the next level.

As the Release team recenters purely on release mechanisms, it
makes sense to spin off the stable branch maintenance under its
own team under the big tent. An election was run to select an
initial PTL and Matt Riedemann was elected.

The Release team mission statement will be redefined in a
subsequent commit to remove deprecated missions.

Change-Id: I8c64b2ca18af4fdb93b33e99c6b9a60223cd2d32
'}]
commit_message:
Spin off stable team as separate team

The Stable branch maintenance team used to be a subteam of the
Release cycle management team, much like the Vulnerability
Management team. However, its tasks were mostly handled by a
separate group, and not having its own identity and PTL arguably
prevented it from reaching the next level.

As the Release team recenters purely on release mechanisms, it
makes sense to spin off the stable branch maintenance under its
own team under the big tent. An election was run to select an
initial PTL and Matt Riedemann was elected.

The Release team mission statement will be redefined in a
subsequent commit to remove deprecated missions.

Change-Id: I8c64b2ca18af4fdb93b33e99c6b9a60223cd2d32

commit_message:
[Verify] Adding possibility to specify concurrency for tests

The `rally verify start` command doesn't allow us to specify
concurrency for Tempest tests. The tests always are run in parallel
mode and use concurrency equal to the count of CPU cores. However,
users may want to use specific concurrency for running tests based
on their deployments and available resources.

This patch adds possibility to specify desired concurrency for tests.

Closes-Bug: #1524968

Change-Id: I3ba2c987c739b13bb03005b1988ee6bd01e8a08d

commit_message:
Merge bashate/pep8 lint jobs in common job

Instead of launching two separate build jobs in our CI infrastructure,
one for bashate and one for pep8, launch a single one. While the jobs
are short, the setup of the images takes a long time, so this is
friendlier to our CI infrastructure.

Use the pep8 environment as common lint target and merge the bashate job
into it.

This patch also renamed dev-requirements to test-requirements to bring it
into line with all other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Ib2683cba4c4dafa7f8391c51be1c8c5319e79488

commit_message:
VNX: Fix issue in deleting cg/cgsnapshot

If user deletes a cg/cgsnapshot quickly after its creation,
driver would report 'not found' warning, and return success
for the deletion, but actually, the object underlying the VNX
is not deleted.

This fix tries to wait the cg and cg snapshot to be available
to make sure it's eligible for deletion.

liberty-backport-potential
Closes-Bug: 1499615
(cherry picked from commit f7b5655d188bfde96333760bbe634f45d4a16395)

Change-Id: Ifae57b9e95e01b1789a37ac7c03e9aad65cd50f7

commit_message:
Fix dvr_single_node failure with OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES flag

Recent change in project-infra introduced a bug that would cause
the dvr-single node jobs to fail.
Patch id: I29e3e098bd972b88551db70e280aa86facbd8f42

This patch address the issue by taking into account the flag
OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES and the neutron_dvr job to perform
the intial setup right.

Change-Id: If10e651acf0f65739d36dddd37f7b45d78f2d81e
Related-Bug: #1521846

commit_message:
Check if device exists before taking action on device

Check for the device existence before taking action
on the device.
Recent change in ip_lib.IPDevice introduced an exists
function.
Some of the function in L3 agent today handles this
check but some does not check for the device state.

This patch would add the check for all devices before
attempting to take action on the device.

Change-Id: Iff7aad27d13e8f4280bc565866c8a161d89a4e34
Closes-Bug: #1419175

commit_message:
Remove router namespace on compute port migration in dvr

On live migration of compute port from one host to another
host and if no more dvr serviceable ports exist in the
host, the router namespace is not removed.

The router namespace should be removed if no more dvr
serviceable port in the original host.

This patch addresses the above issue by deleting the router
namespace when a compute port migrates from original host
to new host.

Closes-Bug: #1518444
Change-Id: Ic0dd04e6c5ebde3031569990ada852b270b29443

commit_message:
Merge bashate/pep8 lint jobs in common job

Instead of launching two separate build jobs in our CI infrastructure,
one for bashate and one for pep8, launch a single one. While the jobs
are short, the setup of the images takes a long time, so this is
friendlier to our CI infrastructure.

Use the pep8 environment as common lint target and merge the bashate job
into it.

This patch also renamed dev-requirements to test-requirements to bring it
into line with all other OpenStack projects.

Current scheme of filling cinder conf  with updated scheduler filters

commit_message:
Fill cinder scheduler filters from cinder modular manifest

Current scheme of filling cinder conf  with updated scheduler filters
in openstack-controller modular manifest is not good, because it is out
of cinder modular task and that's why cinder services could not be
restarted. Let's move this filling to cinder modular manifest.

Change-Id: I7c3bd0c553762b830e3dc48cdc7138664dd5886f
Closes-bug: #1522876

After investigation of the heat breakage, after
we update the policy.json. We discover
that the rbac have never worked as expected.
The only rule that works is role == admin. All other
just can't works.

So the policy file have been changed to, By default project
owner of the alarm should be able to change their alarms.
And anyone can create a new alarm.

Also the alarm definition is now passed to the policy enforcer
to allow it checks owner of the alarms.

Closes-bug: #1504495
Change-Id: I408d839eec84af46adb333a6ad5c49c890513fd0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rbac system

After investigation of the heat breakage, after
we update the policy.json. We discover
that the rbac have never worked as expected.
The only rule that works is role == admin. All other
just can't works.

So the policy file have been changed to, By default project
owner of the alarm should be able to change their alarms.
And anyone can create a new alarm.

Also the alarm definition is now passed to the policy enforcer
to allow it checks owner of the alarms.

Closes-bug: #1504495
Change-Id: I408d839eec84af46adb333a6ad5c49c890513fd0

commit_message:
Implements proper UUID format for the test_compute_api

Currently some of the unittests are using non valid UUID format
for the FieldType UUID.

This is preparation work to add UUID validation in the
oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py.

Without this change adding validation will cause tests to fail.

Depends-On: Ie15c0becad4f016ae730c7fa47d6ec21fdec8783
Change-Id: Id5b67dc2ca54d7accd24220959e4e09de0ccccb3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-03-20 03:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "syslog restart infinite loop fix

Hopefully fixes the problems caused by syslog restarting.
The problem is discussed here: http://bugs.python.org/issue15179

I restarted rsyslog a bunch of times with this patch while running functional
tests and didn't see the infinite loop problems anymore.

Change-Id: Id24c358763c190073d433659b62cd0b8d0f91ba9
"}]
commit_message:
syslog restart infinite loop fix

Hopefully fixes the problems caused by syslog restarting.
The problem is discussed here: http://bugs.python.org/issue15179

I restarted rsyslog a bunch of times with this patch while running functional
tests and didn't see the infinite loop problems anymore.

Change-Id: Id24c358763c190073d433659b62cd0b8d0f91ba9

subject: Validation cli args improvements
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11997, 'name': 'Lennart Regebro', 'email': 'lregebro@redhat.com', 'username': 'lregebro'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-10-16 18:07:50.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Validation cli args improvements

This commit reorganizes the validation cli args into:

--validation-errors-fatal
--validation-errors-nonfatal
--validation-warnings-fatal
--validation-warnings-nonfatal

Errors are fatal by default. This is change from the previous behavior.
However, the change is not all that impactful since many of the fatal
validations aren't actually handled by the existing
--validation-errors-fatal.

Warnings are not fatal by default.

The new cli args give better explicit control over how the validations
are handled. This is done in preparation for the subsequent commits in
this patch series to make sure that all validations that are run by
tripleoclient are properly handled by these cli args.

Change-Id: Ice4424abebcc186aaebfa98013b7c56fe7e82f28
"}]
commit_message:
Validation cli args improvements

This commit reorganizes the validation cli args into:

--validation-errors-fatal
--validation-errors-nonfatal
--validation-warnings-fatal
--validation-warnings-nonfatal

Errors are fatal by default. This is change from the previous behavior.
However, the change is not all that impactful since many of the fatal
validations aren't actually handled by the existing
--validation-errors-fatal.

Warnings are not fatal by default.

The new cli args give better explicit control over how the validations
are handled. This is done in preparation for the subsequent commits in
this patch series to make sure that all validations that are run by
tripleoclient are properly handled by these cli args.

Change-Id: Ice4424abebcc186aaebfa98013b7c56fe7e82f28

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-11 16:07:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': "Make sure bdm.volume_id is set after auto-creating volumes

The test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot test in Tempest does the
following:

1. create volume1 from an image
2. boot server1 from volume1 with delete_on_termination=True and wait
   for the server to be ACTIVE
3. create snapshot from server1 (creates image and volume snapshots)
4. delete server1
5. create server2 from the image snapshot (don't wait for it to be
   ACTIVE - this auto-creates volume2 from the volume snapshot in
   cinder and attaches server2 to it)
6. delete server2 (could still be building/attaching volumes in the
   background)
7. cleanup

There is a race when booting server2, which creates and attaches
volume2, and deleting server2 before it's active.

The volume attach completes and updates the bdm.volume_id in the DB before
we get to _shutdown_instance, but after the delete request is in the API.
The compute API gets potentially stale BDMs and passes those over RPC to
the compute. So we add a check in _shutdown_instance to see if we have
potentially stale volume BDMs and refresh that list if so.

The instance.uuid locks in build_and_run_instance and terminate_instance
create the mutex on the compute host such that the bdm.volume_id should
be set in the database after the volume attach and before terminate_instance
gets the lock. The bdm.volume_id could still be None in _shutdown_instance
if the volume create fails, but we don't have anything to teardown in cinder
in that case anyway.

In the case of the race bug, deleting the volume snapshot in cinder fails
because volume2 was never deleted by nova, so the test fails in
teardown. Note that there is still potential for a race here, this does
not eliminate it, but should narrow the race window.

This also cleans up the logging in attach_block_devices since there
may not be a volume_id at that point (depending on bdm.source_type).

Closes-Bug: #1464259

Change-Id: Ib60d60a5af35be89ad8afbcf44fcffe0b0ce2876
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure bdm.volume_id is set after auto-creating volumes

The test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot test in Tempest does the
following:

1. create volume1 from an image
2. boot server1 from volume1 with delete_on_termination=True and wait
   for the server to be ACTIVE
3. create snapshot from server1 (creates image and volume snapshots)
4. delete server1
5. create server2 from the image snapshot (don't wait for it to be
   ACTIVE - this auto-creates volume2 from the volume snapshot in
   cinder and attaches server2 to it)
6. delete server2 (could still be building/attaching volumes in the
   background)
7. cleanup

There is a race when booting server2, which creates and attaches
volume2, and deleting server2 before it's active.

The volume attach completes and updates the bdm.volume_id in the DB before
we get to _shutdown_instance, but after the delete request is in the API.
The compute API gets potentially stale BDMs and passes those over RPC to
the compute. So we add a check in _shutdown_instance to see if we have
potentially stale volume BDMs and refresh that list if so.

The instance.uuid locks in build_and_run_instance and terminate_instance
create the mutex on the compute host such that the bdm.volume_id should
be set in the database after the volume attach and before terminate_instance
gets the lock. The bdm.volume_id could still be None in _shutdown_instance
if the volume create fails, but we don't have anything to teardown in cinder
in that case anyway.

In the case of the race bug, deleting the volume snapshot in cinder fails
because volume2 was never deleted by nova, so the test fails in
teardown. Note that there is still potential for a race here, this does
not eliminate it, but should narrow the race window.

This also cleans up the logging in attach_block_devices since there
may not be a volume_id at that point (depending on bdm.source_type).

Closes-Bug: #1464259

Change-Id: Ib60d60a5af35be89ad8afbcf44fcffe0b0ce2876

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-12-08 17:34:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_keepalived.py'], 'message': "Skip keepalived_respawns test

keepalived fails to respawn after crash for > 1.2.11 version.

When keepalived starts, it spawns vrrp thread to monitor vrrp forked
process. It also creates a vrrp pid file. When the process is killed, and
it's restarted, the the new keepalived process runs with -P, so
when we validate whether we are already running,  we check vrrp pid file.
Since we never clean up the file before starting the process, and the process
dies without a chance to clean up the file as part of its signal
handler, respawn never works.

keepalived_respawns test should be skipped until bug is resolved.
See also: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1286729

Change-Id: Ic111573e0cd5ad5bfe70b0f38ec0203c10d52e34
Related-Bug: #1511311
"}]
commit_message:
Skip keepalived_respawns test

keepalived fails to respawn after crash for > 1.2.11 version.

When keepalived starts, it spawns vrrp thread to monitor vrrp forked
process. It also creates a vrrp pid file. When the process is killed, and
it's restarted, the the new keepalived process runs with -P, so
when we validate whether we are already running,  we check vrrp pid file.
Since we never clean up the file before starting the process, and the process
dies without a chance to clean up the file as part of its signal
handler, respawn never works.

keepalived_respawns test should be skipped until bug is resolved.
See also: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1286729

Change-Id: Ic111573e0cd5ad5bfe70b0f38ec0203c10d52e34
Related-Bug: #1511311

to be stable interfaces. These are tested via a separate tox
environment, legacy_drivers.

commit_message:
Increase memory restriction to 9023M

On OVH and Bluebox, the memory layout is such that there is still
significant (~900M) memory above the 8192M address.  Increase the
limit to encompass that, which will bring these providers up to
approximately 8G, while increasing hpcloud (which is the actual
target of this restriction) to about 8.5G.

Change-Id: I5c121be55cadad13ad5807968f33b492f9b1e215

Use the pep8 environment as common lint target and merge the bashate job

commit_message:
Merge bashate/pep8 lint jobs in common job

Instead of launching two separate build jobs in our CI infrastructure,
one for bashate and one for pep8, launch a single one. While the jobs
are short, the setup of the images takes a long time, so this is
friendlier to our CI infrastructure.

Use the pep8 environment as common lint target and merge the bashate job
into it.

This patch also renamed dev-requirements to test-requirements to bring it
into line with all other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Idda19174cb55885dcf174a348be5b6750e352255

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-11 17:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': "rework warning messages for extension whitelist/blacklist

The API v2.1 extension loader was issuing a WARN for every single
extension that was listed in a white or blacklist. This is not a
warning for the administrator, this is a thing they chose to do. We
already have an INFO message that says all the extensions that got loaded.

The only WARN we should consider is when they put items in both the
white and black lists, and we decided to ignore the whitelist. That
warning message is added, as that's one of those things that could
drive people nuts trying to figure out why something didn't load when
added to the whitelist.

The function is denormalized and renamed to be more explicit about
what's going on.

Change-Id: I3ee8f04867509072c7cd6c0f1c1a87f893706595
"}]
commit_message:
rework warning messages for extension whitelist/blacklist

The API v2.1 extension loader was issuing a WARN for every single
extension that was listed in a white or blacklist. This is not a
warning for the administrator, this is a thing they chose to do. We
already have an INFO message that says all the extensions that got loaded.

The only WARN we should consider is when they put items in both the
white and black lists, and we decided to ignore the whitelist. That
warning message is added, as that's one of those things that could
drive people nuts trying to figure out why something didn't load when
added to the whitelist.

The function is denormalized and renamed to be more explicit about
what's going on.

Change-Id: I3ee8f04867509072c7cd6c0f1c1a87f893706595

commit_message:
Fix call to Client() with 2 api_version args

The Client() uses api_version as the positional
parameter, so also sending the api_version as a kwarg
causes a python error. The log shows this "recoverable"
error, but the UI becomes unusable.

Recoverable error: Client() got multiple values for
keyword argument 'api_version'

Change-Id: I8c8287899f7659273f6768f3c441aa48904dfc74
Closes-Bug: #1524508
(cherry picked from commit 2ec35ef8ff3161c104eee2c5f99efd0c407bbc21)

commit_message:
tests: block when acquiring processing lock

In tests, not blocking when processing the data in background might
trigger a race condition since all the tests run in parallel on the same
database.

Change-Id: Id808f9e659f242fdaecd52cad08a6d00c96ac051
(cherry picked from commit 9309cdc8f64bb0c3ea14a27490c0e81770206c8c)

commit_message:
gnocchi: fix cache hash logic

The cache check logic was not returned the new hash is
case of the cache key was not present.

Also sometimes, on update, the resource attributes could have
metric set, the generated hash was wrong in that case.

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I519b9efec6b01352c5330cd8709bf671a41006a7

to pass the microverion in request header.

which will be used to send in microversion header of each
method of that service client.

Further each compute service clients will be derived from this
class to support microversion testing.

We are currently doing it in Tempest and after getting enough
proof of testing, this will be sync to Tempest-lib.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions-testing-support

Change-Id: Ib7bb5804a0b6e55d189efc742e61412cb42d7e79

commit_message:
Add compute client base class for microversion support

This commit adds the base class for compute service clients
to pass the microverion in request header.

Microversion is being set on service client at class level
which will be used to send in microversion header of each
method of that service client.

Further each compute service clients will be derived from this
class to support microversion testing.

We are currently doing it in Tempest and after getting enough
proof of testing, this will be sync to Tempest-lib.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions-testing-support

Change-Id: Ib7bb5804a0b6e55d189efc742e61412cb42d7e79

commit_message:
Keystone domain fix

The keystone module is not able to function when using Keystone
and the multi-domain backend. This issue is caused because the
domain argument is not passed into the client calls. to resolve
this issue the module has been updated to pass through the domain
to the various client calls where needed

Closes-Bug: #1518351
Closes-Bug: #1519174
Change-Id: Ie19f1658d770cc421e23ebb59e658624cf668840
Co-Authored-By: Tiago Gomes <tiago.gomes@codethink.co.uk>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit f490880abecd5d3e2acf2642024dab7a02c08975)

commit_message:
Make server action methods[a-c] use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes server action methods[a-c] use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I62deef121ef74152474976d5619ed1bbb0e051b2

commit_message:

commit_message:
using a consistent uuid as cache namespace

Using dynamically generated uuid as cache namespace will cause
each collector process has its own cache key. And the key will
changed after restart.

This patch change the uuid from generating randomly to statically.

Change-Id: Ic181e66db7771a87219ca93229b9358068dab006
Closes-Bug:#1523127

commit_message:
Validate domain for DB-based domain config. CRUD

For CRUD of Identity API-based domain-specific driver configuration
in database store, if the client provides an invalid domain id,
the request shall be rejected with a response 404 domain not found.

Change-Id: I9e861d450da1a49d31bac08bea12a0e2e84c6476
Closes-Bug: 1524562

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-14 19:09:20.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_common.py'], 'message': "Separate rbac calculation from _make_network_dict

When a subnet dict was being created, it was calling
_make_network_dict to get the 'shared' flag for the
subnet. The issue with this is that the _make_network_dict
function would iterate over the subnets on the passed in
network object, which would trigger a database lookup
of all of the subnets.

This patch just separates the 'shared' flag calculation out
into a separate function that both calls can leverage.

Change-Id: I2cb766ce1fd8ddcc75209f9e92221a3b77015ea2
Closes-Bug: #1525295
Partial-Bug: #1513782
"}]
commit_message:
Separate rbac calculation from _make_network_dict

When a subnet dict was being created, it was calling
_make_network_dict to get the 'shared' flag for the
subnet. The issue with this is that the _make_network_dict
function would iterate over the subnets on the passed in
network object, which would trigger a database lookup
of all of the subnets.

This patch just separates the 'shared' flag calculation out
into a separate function that both calls can leverage.

Change-Id: I2cb766ce1fd8ddcc75209f9e92221a3b77015ea2
Closes-Bug: #1525295
Partial-Bug: #1513782

commit_message:
Bump oslo.utils to 3.2.0

We added new module imageutils in version 3.1.0. It can be used by
Nova/Cinder/Ironic. But oslo.utils 3.1.0 removed it's runtime
dependency on netifaces which breaks nearly everyone, so bump
oslo.utils' version to 3.2.0

Change-Id: Ib4def482365324d1c8f93d58a46f12912e053fa0

commit_message:
Add Kubernetes UI

All services (except kublet) in Kubernetes can be run in container

commit_message:
Internationalization (i18n) - Enable French locale

Our project should now enable its internationalization.
This patchset add the french locale to the project but also
refactors the codebase to following the oslo_i18n recommendations.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint support-translation

Change-Id: I0e4fbf05d16afb5e25bac78438c640f147c754b1

subject: Updated repo for new org
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-12-14 15:20:02.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible.cfg', 'tests/inventory', '.gitignore', 'tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', '.gitreview', 'tasks/galera_post_install.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'templates/my.cnf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Updated repo for new org

The role was changed to make it compatible with the OpenStack
CI. The changes effect defaults, handlers, and the tests for 
the role and adds gitignore/review files. 

The changes essentially get the role to a state where its passing
the tests which are spinning up a galera cluster, adding users 
and databases, and then testing integrity from every node. The 
tests specifically ensure we're able to guarantee that after the
role runs everything works. Previously to these changes the role
assumed everything was working and nothing had been done to 
guarantee cluster state. 

In the handler changes, the temporary "sst" directory is cleaned up
should the handler restart fail. This ensure that a node is in a clean
state if a leftover sst directory was on the disk which would cause 
a node to fail to join a cluster or bootstrap. Additionally the 
environment variable "MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT" is now being passed
into the init script because the defaults are not being sourced
at the init script runtime. 

In the task changes a new configuration file, that is part of the 
mariadb package, is being removed which has unforeseen options within
it causing no logs to be created.

the default option "galera_innodb_additional_mem_pool_size" was removed
because its no longer valid within MariaDB10 and we'd never caught that
error message until now.

The tests were updated to support running the role from a user which 
was not root.

Change-Id: I16af30c660790656fc2d59f9943c172b88098905
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>'}]
commit_message:
Updated repo for new org

The role was changed to make it compatible with the OpenStack
CI. The changes effect defaults, handlers, and the tests for 
the role and adds gitignore/review files. 

The changes essentially get the role to a state where its passing
the tests which are spinning up a galera cluster, adding users 
and databases, and then testing integrity from every node. The 
tests specifically ensure we're able to guarantee that after the
role runs everything works. Previously to these changes the role
assumed everything was working and nothing had been done to 
guarantee cluster state. 

In the handler changes, the temporary "sst" directory is cleaned up
should the handler restart fail. This ensure that a node is in a clean
state if a leftover sst directory was on the disk which would cause 
a node to fail to join a cluster or bootstrap. Additionally the 
environment variable "MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT" is now being passed
into the init script because the defaults are not being sourced
at the init script runtime. 

In the task changes a new configuration file, that is part of the 
mariadb package, is being removed which has unforeseen options within
it causing no logs to be created.

the default option "galera_innodb_additional_mem_pool_size" was removed
because its no longer valid within MariaDB10 and we'd never caught that
error message until now.

The tests were updated to support running the role from a user which 
was not root.

Change-Id: I16af30c660790656fc2d59f9943c172b88098905
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix df-ext-services.sh run under devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 15:30:03.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/df-ext-services.sh', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "Fix df-ext-services.sh run under devstack

Commit 421850636755a256e8750a7017a28ef072ebcbb4 includes
devstack neutron scripts which triggers a dependency issue
happens in df-ext-services.sh.

df-ext-services.sh which doesn't run under devstack directory cannot
locate $TOP_DIR which points to devstack directory in plugin.sh.

In this patch, we dynamically locates and updates $TOP_DIR
in df-ext-services.sh.

Change-Id: I816f8157b4c1520707f6d8664b9390a9e3fed6fb
Closes-Bug: #1525499
"}]
commit_message:
Fix df-ext-services.sh run under devstack

Commit 421850636755a256e8750a7017a28ef072ebcbb4 includes
devstack neutron scripts which triggers a dependency issue
happens in df-ext-services.sh.

df-ext-services.sh which doesn't run under devstack directory cannot
locate $TOP_DIR which points to devstack directory in plugin.sh.

In this patch, we dynamically locates and updates $TOP_DIR
in df-ext-services.sh.

Change-Id: I816f8157b4c1520707f6d8664b9390a9e3fed6fb
Closes-Bug: #1525499

subject: Disable py27 job for python-tackerclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-11 02:12:13.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Disable py27 job for python-tackerclient

python-tackerclient has numerous failing test cases. With python-
jobs enabled now for python-tackerclient [1], py27 job is failing
at Jenkins gate and blocking all patches. To unblock this critical
issue, py27 jobs will be temporarily disabled for now until all
unit test cases are fixed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/255208/2

Change-Id: I983fe166276783eef0e3de51a975e92f22fe4ac3
'}]
commit_message:
Disable py27 job for python-tackerclient

python-tackerclient has numerous failing test cases. With python-
jobs enabled now for python-tackerclient [1], py27 job is failing
at Jenkins gate and blocking all patches. To unblock this critical
issue, py27 jobs will be temporarily disabled for now until all
unit test cases are fixed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/255208/2

Change-Id: I983fe166276783eef0e3de51a975e92f22fe4ac3

commit_message:
Fix the parameter order of assertEqual in swiftclient

On assertEqual, the parameter order should be (expected, actual).
Some of the tests in python-swiftclient were written with invalid
parameter orders.  This introduces the correct parameter order.

Change-Id: I124c8e22eb705c1bf61c45f54e62dbc64fa80a7f
Partial-Bug: 1277104

Multiple calls can get the same device. This patch adds synchronization
to create_volume, delete_volume and create_cloned_volume to avoid race

commit_message:
Add synchronization in Block Device driver

Multiple calls can get the same device. This patch adds synchronization
to create_volume, delete_volume and create_cloned_volume to avoid race
conditions. The delete_volume method is modified to avoid code duplication
in the implementation of delete_snapshot method for snapshot in the next
patch. Also it adds update provider_location and host to mark device as
used to avoid race with other threads. It uses object notation instead
of dict notation to a volume and snapshot.

Change-Id: I0b8fb28dde367c3f34dd0b6b9d98372cfff65d45
Closes-Bug: #1335904

commit_message:
Add documentation for swiftless intermediate images

This commit adds documentation for Swiftless
deploy for iscsi_ilo and agent_ilo drivers for hosting
intermediate images on local webserver.

The users can still use glance(which uses swift as backend store)
to host the user inputs like instance_info/image_source,
driver_info/deploy_ramdisk, etc.

Partial-Bug: #1513314

Change-Id: I06cd928414c120eec2ccbd3e3a8cd48fc44a2091

commit_message:
Modify agent: handle multiple port attach sources

This is needed to support, for instance, E-VPN parameters
to be contributed to by the ML2 mech_driver and by the
BGPVPN service plugin.

Other changes in this refactoring:
- Modify BGP VPN port attach handling.
- No need to specify notifiers and vpn types on attach,
  re-sending all plugs for each ports.
- Unplug all notifiers port informations on port detach.

Co-Author: Yannick Thomas <ythomas1.ext@orange.com>
Change-Id: I7b59363f8d14069041ab8f1dab43985a6684a8f9
(cherry picked from commit c9a03ffbb5946fc5e2ab73047b6a1d142eca102d)

commit_message:
Point registry at tripleoupstream

The tripleoupstream registry contains images that are built
every time there is a change in delorean.

The gate also needs this.

commit_message:
Change the Atomic image name so it's less specific

The atomic image name in glance was being set to 'fedora-atomic'.
The glance image can be any form of atomic distro so we shouldn't
name this specifically 'fedora-atomic', but instead 'atomic-image'.

Change-Id: Ic539b82b92e3fdd834750e591d8622b7dc85fc6d
(cherry picked from commit 266d123286e91bb733102ae20f607caeead520f2)

commit_message:
Nova-libvirt needs to bind to /sys/fs/cgroup

Nova-compute was mounting in /sys/fs/cgroup when the libvirt
container is the one that actually needs it.

Change-Id: Iae5c7ad24083a8547474611d72f015c4fd23a073
(cherry picked from commit 1264b1bba2b7528b00d745533768a30896e064d7)

commit_message:
Add local docker registry support

Create a set of environment variables that allows us to configure
a docker registry for deployment.  This patch assumes there is a
local docker registry already setup with the images loaded in place.

Change-Id: Iaafaf23eb3fa8b24bcd8f73bb38c552bea629607
Signed-off-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 092bcd9283db3379cc2ccc50499e7904d9647c25)

commit_message:
Update docker compute environment to use json config

In liberty, Kolla copies around files and runs the service given
a specified command, by reading a json file.

This will update the existing work to follow that template by
creating a json file for each of the services and pushing it
into the containers.

Change-Id: I5085d1896ea965fd8854765b055068a5ad30bcfd
Co-Authored-By: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3a9186d6585d13528bf904a40556242c02ba4233)

Currently quotas are sometimes checked in cinder.volume.manager,

two commits that aim to make these checks more consistent by moving
calls from the manager to the API. This way, we can give the user

commit_message:
Move snapshot and volume quota checks to API

Currently quotas are sometimes checked in cinder.volume.manager,
and other times checked in cinder.volume.api. This patch is one of
two commits that aim to make these checks more consistent by moving
calls from the manager to the API. This way, we can give the user
feedback before launching the RPC call. If the quotas fail to update,
an exception will be raised in the API to inform the user before
the action takes place unless the force option is set to True.

Change-Id: I49e3e2bf3e1621e9e8d9645b7ad09154ffb448c3
APIImpact
Partial-bug: #1508249

commit_message:
Update decorator "update_ostf"

- make updating of ostf-server code via package
not via the patch
- add test gate_ostf_update

Next variables should be exported:
UPDATE_FUEL=True
UPDATE_FUEL_PATH=/path/to/dir/with/package

Change-Id: I53a768dfb4f755ab1b59db822ce571e00a0b2cb0
Closes-Bug: #1517487

subject: Merge bashate/pep8 lint jobs in common job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-15 10:37:12.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'readme.rst', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Merge bashate/pep8 lint jobs in common job

Instead of launching two separate build jobs in our CI infrastructure,
one for bashate and one for pep8, launch a single one. While the jobs
are short, the setup of the images takes a long time, so this is
friendlier to our CI infrastructure.

Use the pep8 environment as common lint target and merge the bashate job
into it.

This patch also renamed dev-requirements to test-requirements to bring it
into line with all other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Icd665718713fcd7ad4a598c73268a346d511c8e5
'}]
commit_message:
Merge bashate/pep8 lint jobs in common job

Instead of launching two separate build jobs in our CI infrastructure,
one for bashate and one for pep8, launch a single one. While the jobs
are short, the setup of the images takes a long time, so this is
friendlier to our CI infrastructure.

Use the pep8 environment as common lint target and merge the bashate job
into it.

This patch also renamed dev-requirements to test-requirements to bring it
into line with all other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Icd665718713fcd7ad4a598c73268a346d511c8e5

commit_message:
Minor fixes to TLS related resources

* Fixed a comment to avoid ambiguity with concepts in Heat
* Removed default values from necessary parameters in the TLS
  environment
* Simplified setting of the cert/key into a file.

Change-Id: I351778150a6fbf7affe1a0fddb1abb9869324dfc
(cherry picked from commit ab231006a9c295f3afc669979896e8e589a0bccf)

subject: Output the SSL Certificate and Key modulus
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-09 09:29:47.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/extraconfig/tls/no-tls.yaml', 'puppet/extraconfig/tls/tls-cert-inject.yaml'], 'message': 'Output the SSL Certificate and Key modulus

Provides a simple mechanism to verify the correct certificates
landed.

A quick and simple way to verify SSL certificates were generated for
a given key is by comparing the modulus of the two.  By outputing
the key modulus and certificate modulus we offer a way to verify
that the right cert and key have been deployed without compromising
any of the secrets.

Change-Id: I882c9840719a09795ba8057a19b0b3985e036c3c
(cherry picked from commit 5bfef1a17cc2fd7208a3ef95a046a3820561b102)
'}]
commit_message:
Output the SSL Certificate and Key modulus

Provides a simple mechanism to verify the correct certificates
landed.

A quick and simple way to verify SSL certificates were generated for
a given key is by comparing the modulus of the two.  By outputing
the key modulus and certificate modulus we offer a way to verify
that the right cert and key have been deployed without compromising
any of the secrets.

Change-Id: I882c9840719a09795ba8057a19b0b3985e036c3c
(cherry picked from commit 5bfef1a17cc2fd7208a3ef95a046a3820561b102)

subject: Enable trust anchor injection
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-09 09:29:47.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/extraconfig/tls/no-ca.yaml', 'puppet/controller.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage.yaml', 'environments/inject-trust-anchor.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'puppet/ceph-storage.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage.yaml', 'puppet/extraconfig/tls/ca-inject.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable trust anchor injection

This commit enables the injection of a trust anchor or root
certificate into every node in the overcloud. This is in case that the
TLS certificates for the controllers are signed with a self-signed CA
or if the deployer would like to inject a relevant root certificate
for other purposes. In this case the other nodes might need to have
the root certificate in their trust chain in order to do proper
validation

Change-Id: Ia45180fe0bb979cf12d19f039dbfd22e26fb4856
(cherry picked from commit 14c4417e425f832660bd54118112fc991564b38d)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable trust anchor injection

This commit enables the injection of a trust anchor or root
certificate into every node in the overcloud. This is in case that the
TLS certificates for the controllers are signed with a self-signed CA
or if the deployer would like to inject a relevant root certificate
for other purposes. In this case the other nodes might need to have
the root certificate in their trust chain in order to do proper
validation

Change-Id: Ia45180fe0bb979cf12d19f039dbfd22e26fb4856
(cherry picked from commit 14c4417e425f832660bd54118112fc991564b38d)

commit_message:
Inject TLS certificate and keys for the Overcloud

This is a first implementation of adding TLS termination to the load
balancer in the controllers. The implementation was made so that the
appropriate certificate/private key in PEM format is copied to the
appropriate controller(s) via a software deployment resource.

And the path is then referenced on the HAProxy configuration, but this
part was left commented out because we need to be able to configure the
keystone endpoints in order for this to work properly.

Conflict:
    puppet/controller.yaml

(Conflict due to not backporting I0e86318eb5521e540cc567ce9d77e1060086d48b )

Change-Id: I0ba8e38d75a0c628d8132a66dc25a30fc5183c79
(cherry picked from commit 97b12afbadeadac0be348b7cc263b090f6e6f0b8)

subject: fix fileutils ut code random failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 13:50:31.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/tests/test_fileutils.py'], 'message': 'fix fileutils ut code random failure

test_file_with_not_existing_path_and_not_default_suffix and
test_file_with_not_existing_path have created tempory file which
share same directory tree, when run test code parallel, one might
fail because the other one has cleaned that directory.

This patch replaces constant directory name with random name.

Change-Id: If663f81bd2f09b8d07fb371bd27237044f17ee6f
Closes-Bug: #1526323
'}]
commit_message:
fix fileutils ut code random failure

test_file_with_not_existing_path_and_not_default_suffix and
test_file_with_not_existing_path have created tempory file which
share same directory tree, when run test code parallel, one might
fail because the other one has cleaned that directory.

This patch replaces constant directory name with random name.

Change-Id: If663f81bd2f09b8d07fb371bd27237044f17ee6f
Closes-Bug: #1526323

subject: Fix the URL of OS-KSADM/roles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 06:59:20.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v2.0/wadl/OS-KSADM-admin.wadl'], 'message': "Fix the URL of OS-KSADM/roles

As the following keystone/contrib/admin_crud/core.py, the URL of
create_role is '/OS-KSADM/roles':

  220         # Role Operations
  221         mapper.connect(
  222             '/OS-KSADM/roles',
  223             controller=role_controller,
  224             action='create_role',
  225             conditions=dict(method=['POST']))

So this patch fixes the URL based on the implementation.

Change-Id: Ieefd560db1a4e2fc10ed90e94bc26abeaa5207f8
Closes-Bug: #1526166
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the URL of OS-KSADM/roles

As the following keystone/contrib/admin_crud/core.py, the URL of
create_role is '/OS-KSADM/roles':

  220         # Role Operations
  221         mapper.connect(
  222             '/OS-KSADM/roles',
  223             controller=role_controller,
  224             action='create_role',
  225             conditions=dict(method=['POST']))

So this patch fixes the URL based on the implementation.

Change-Id: Ieefd560db1a4e2fc10ed90e94bc26abeaa5207f8
Closes-Bug: #1526166

commit_message:
Remove check for managed cloud role

Rackspace Public Cloud now runs managed cloud
automation on all cloud servers. Therefore, we must
check for managed cloud related statuses on all
cloud servers on the Rackspace Public Cloud.

Co-Authored-By: Randall Burt <randall.burt@rackpsace.com>
Change-Id: I07cf756005b37a3a94f86f550b11658e77f2ba27
Closes-Bug: #1526052

commit_message:
Let all version info be read from the setup.cfg

The Openstack project should follow this style, which forces all
version information being read from the setup.cfg. This helps
keep the version information unique.

Ref can be found at: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/

Change-Id: Ied7043863b6677487f96fc8f1600ecef0e10818d
Closes-Bug: #1526130

subject: Drop py33 support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 08:30:51.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Drop py33 support

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra
for our CI, we should drop py33 support too.

Change-Id: I73a53c2c16b3bc8d7cf2c2e491e3be4c4d007828
Closes-Bug: #1526170
'}]
commit_message:
Drop py33 support

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra
for our CI, we should drop py33 support too.

Change-Id: I73a53c2c16b3bc8d7cf2c2e491e3be4c4d007828
Closes-Bug: #1526170

subject: Add sphinx_rtd_theme to enhance doc gate jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-15 08:09:39.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add sphinx_rtd_theme to enhance doc gate jobs

When it gets to submitting & reviewing patches for the project documentation,
it is very convenient to surf through the docs generated by Sphinx in a special
Gate job. The problem is that Sphinx uses in gates a theme which is different
from that used on ReadTheDocs. So the docs generated in gates look differently
from the docs that we have on ReadTheDocs, while the desired behaviour is to
have the same Sphinx theme both on ReadTheDocs and in gates.

Currently murano project has documentation on read the docs

Change-Id: Idd899148184c0490099b2d1b141342d86bcef458
'}]
commit_message:
Add sphinx_rtd_theme to enhance doc gate jobs

When it gets to submitting & reviewing patches for the project documentation,
it is very convenient to surf through the docs generated by Sphinx in a special
Gate job. The problem is that Sphinx uses in gates a theme which is different
from that used on ReadTheDocs. So the docs generated in gates look differently
from the docs that we have on ReadTheDocs, while the desired behaviour is to
have the same Sphinx theme both on ReadTheDocs and in gates.

Currently murano project has documentation on read the docs

Change-Id: Idd899148184c0490099b2d1b141342d86bcef458

commit_message:
Delete etcd DB data every stack

Previously the etcd DB was not cleaned between stacks
which meant that old data (networks) still exists.
This change delete the etcd DB every stack

Change-Id: I0ec52bac803d0f96683f1c6ea6b5996f39eab300

commit_message:
Router: Add "router create" command using SDK

This patch adds "router create" command to osc using sdk.

NOTE: Test for --project needs support for fake identity client v2 and v3.
      These tests will be added in other patches.
NOTE: external_gateway_info and routes are not supported to be passed to
      create command now. They will be supported in another tow patches.
NOTE: Creating a ha router is not supported for now. Will support it in
      another patch.

Change-Id: I7642295d27c27dd498331ae1da1c293706d8f6af
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
Partial-bug: #1519503

subject: Scale back on how many warnings we issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-11 11:45:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/common/http.py'], 'message': 'Scale back on how many warnings we issue

* Remove "Request returned failure status" warning, it does not carry
  any helpful information for an operator (or anyone).
* Demote retry warnings to debug level. Retrying is essentially a normal
  thing in the real world, and currently we're spamming logs with warnings.
  http://logs.openstack.org/93/255793/3/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-agent_ssh/25175ed/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE

Change-Id: I6c40581b9dc5ab1fe3af4b882ede17a13edacc66
Closes-Bug: #1525002
'}]
commit_message:
Scale back on how many warnings we issue

* Remove "Request returned failure status" warning, it does not carry
  any helpful information for an operator (or anyone).
* Demote retry warnings to debug level. Retrying is essentially a normal
  thing in the real world, and currently we're spamming logs with warnings.
  http://logs.openstack.org/93/255793/3/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-agent_ssh/25175ed/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE

Change-Id: I6c40581b9dc5ab1fe3af4b882ede17a13edacc66
Closes-Bug: #1525002

subject: Change String to Boolean type when listing cluster policies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 03:14:26.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/api/openstack/v1/cluster_policies.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/apiv1/test_cluster_policies.py'], 'message': "Change String to Boolean type when listing cluster policies

Currently when listing a cluster's policies by filtering 'enabled'
field, the value 'true/False' is passed as a string to the server,
the server should change it to boolean type before filtering.

Change-Id: I50b2143d759ac381f09cdddb54baa1a7eed22259
Closes-bug: #1526142
"}]
commit_message:
Change String to Boolean type when listing cluster policies

Currently when listing a cluster's policies by filtering 'enabled'
field, the value 'true/False' is passed as a string to the server,
the server should change it to boolean type before filtering.

Change-Id: I50b2143d759ac381f09cdddb54baa1a7eed22259
Closes-bug: #1526142

the communication with swift for ironic conductor and

for swift endpoint.

Co-Authored-By: Ramakrishnan G <rameshg87@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update swift HTTPs information in ilo documentation

This commit updates iLO driver documentation to reflect
that HTTPS has to enabled in swift explicitly to encrypt
the communication with swift for ironic conductor and
iLO. It also provides pointers on how to enable HTTPS
for swift endpoint.

Co-Authored-By: Ramakrishnan G <rameshg87@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: 1511227
Change-Id: Ie0763259d6e1a84c19f89efeb5a19f7c8ca9fc8a

subject: Move sphinx diag packages deps to doc tox job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 14:42:29.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Move sphinx diag packages deps to doc tox job

Having sphinxcontrib-*diag in requirements does not
work in kilo because this package is not in
global-requirements.

This changes moves the requirements for sphinxcontrib-*diag
from requirements.txt to the deps specific to the tox job for
documentation.

Change-Id: I3c58603bf5fd1f846b4c5da860fac3e79b30ebed
'}]
commit_message:
Move sphinx diag packages deps to doc tox job

Having sphinxcontrib-*diag in requirements does not
work in kilo because this package is not in
global-requirements.

This changes moves the requirements for sphinxcontrib-*diag
from requirements.txt to the deps specific to the tox job for
documentation.

Change-Id: I3c58603bf5fd1f846b4c5da860fac3e79b30ebed

subject: Fix server deletes when cinder isn't available
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-14 15:58:25.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_delete_server.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Fix server deletes when cinder isn't available

This commit fixes an issue when trying to delete a server and cinder
isn't available. Cinder isn't actually a required component of a cloud
and some public clouds (like vexxhost) don't deploy it, so we shouldn't
unconditionally attempt to talk to cinder without being able to handle
this case.

Change-Id: Ia1e19aad711c43fec21e2c1e5ad64b69acb561d3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix server deletes when cinder isn't available

This commit fixes an issue when trying to delete a server and cinder
isn't available. Cinder isn't actually a required component of a cloud
and some public clouds (like vexxhost) don't deploy it, so we shouldn't
unconditionally attempt to talk to cinder without being able to handle
this case.

Change-Id: Ia1e19aad711c43fec21e2c1e5ad64b69acb561d3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 09:38:43.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove py26 support from bifrost

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I4425ae0d5d89862efa556a6cf28dfb661563433b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove py26 support from bifrost

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I4425ae0d5d89862efa556a6cf28dfb661563433b

subject: Bug fix: create_stack() fails when waiting
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-14 14:13:08.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/create-stack-fix-12dbb59a48ac7442.yaml', 'shade/tests/unit/test_stack.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Bug fix: create_stack() fails when waiting

The create_stack() call had two bugs: If wait was True, it attempted
to call an iterate method that had been moved to _utils; it also did
not return the stack from the get_stack() calls.

Change-Id: I2588e3a84729a8f1b3bfcb6d401c7d51fb16832b
'}]
commit_message:
Bug fix: create_stack() fails when waiting

The create_stack() call had two bugs: If wait was True, it attempted
to call an iterate method that had been moved to _utils; it also did
not return the stack from the get_stack() calls.

Change-Id: I2588e3a84729a8f1b3bfcb6d401c7d51fb16832b

This patch removes exceptions that are not used in the glanceclient. As
they are not ever thrown we don't need them in the exceptions file. This
includes some depreciated exceptions, that are no longer used.

This also makes some of the current exceptions not depend on the remaining
still used deprecated exceptions.

Change-Id: I099c1dcfde2d051d2eb6d65ae536853456085102

commit_message:
Clean up exceptions

This patch removes exceptions that are not used in the glanceclient. As
they are not ever thrown we don't need them in the exceptions file. This
includes some depreciated exceptions, that are no longer used.

This also makes some of the current exceptions not depend on the remaining
still used deprecated exceptions.

Change-Id: I099c1dcfde2d051d2eb6d65ae536853456085102

subject: Stop ignore skipped crypt_operation option
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-10 18:33:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Stop ignore skipped crypt_operation option

Previously we used "nargs='?'" parameter for 'crypt_operation' option.
It leads to situation, when we execute this command without any result
or error.
Now when user will try to execute this command he will get message, that
should specify 'crypt_operation' option.

Note, that we used same parameters for other heat-manage commands.
However, it can be used, because if user will not provide these options,
then commands will be executed with default values (sometimes it's None).
All these default values are expected in utility functions or db
functions.

Also comments were added for clarification commands and their arguments.

Change-Id: I561bc7fc83e6d845c9b59d85c59650e640001190'}]
commit_message:
Stop ignore skipped crypt_operation option

Previously we used "nargs='?'" parameter for 'crypt_operation' option.
It leads to situation, when we execute this command without any result
or error.
Now when user will try to execute this command he will get message, that
should specify 'crypt_operation' option.

Note, that we used same parameters for other heat-manage commands.
However, it can be used, because if user will not provide these options,
then commands will be executed with default values (sometimes it's None).
All these default values are expected in utility functions or db
functions.

Also comments were added for clarification commands and their arguments.

Change-Id: I561bc7fc83e6d845c9b59d85c59650e640001190

This adds the CORS support middleware to Murano, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly. Included
are Murano's custom headers, so that anyone activating this

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
